dt: {bc}something (such as a need or desire) that causes a person to act
{bc}a recurrent phrase or figure that is developed through the course of a musical composition

pt: {sc}motive{/sc} {sc}impulse{/sc} {sc}incentive{/sc} {sc}inducement{/sc} {sc}spur{/sc} {sc}goad{/sc} mean a stimulus to action. {sc}motive{/sc} implies an emotion or desire operating on the will and causing it to act.
{sc}impulse{/sc} suggests a driving power arising from personal temperament or constitution.
{sc}incentive{/sc} applies to an external influence (such as an expected reward) inciting to action.

pt.t: a bonus was offered as an {it}incentive{/it}

pt: {sc}inducement{/sc} suggests a motive prompted by the deliberate enticements or allurements of another.

pt.t: offered a watch as an {it}inducement{/it} to subscribe

pt: {sc}spur{/sc} applies to a motive that stimulates the faculties or increases energy or ardor.
{sc}goad{/sc} suggests a motive that keeps one going against one's will or desire.

pt.t: thought insecurity a {it}goad{/it} to worker efficiency
